intro: Gymnogramma chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean shield fern, is a species of fern native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are bioluminescent, a unique feature that aids in attracting certain nocturnal pollinators. Gymnogramma chilensis plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
